items.to_string:
Title Update notebooks to include environment name in resource names

Value Statement

As a BIP AI Tenant who creates resources via notebooks, I need the ability to include the environment name in resource names so that resources are easily identified and managed across environments.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user runs a tenant resources notebook, all created resources include the environment name in their names. Manual validation: Confirm resource names reflect the environment for each notebook.

Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who supports AWS AI workflows, I need the ability to utilize and provide examples for Lambda functions so that tenants can easily configure Lambda functions to use with Bedrock agents and more.

Acceptance Criteria
When a tenant needs to implement Lambda functions in their workflow, they can refer to the example notebook in the tenant resources repo to streamline the setup process. 
Notebook includes how to invoke and update a Lambda function through the SDK. Includes how to run Bedrock agents through Lambda functions. Also includes how to troubleshoot common errors and links to useful documentation.

Value Statement
As a BIP AI Tenant who uses Bedrock Agents and Knowledge Bases, I need the ability to use inference profiles reliably so that I can invoke models without errors and follow platform requirements.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user runs tenant resources notebooks for Agents and Knowledge Bases with inference profiles, model invocation works as expected.
Issues with inference profiles are diagnosed and addressed for both Agents and Knowledge Bases.
Manual validation: Confirm successful usage of inference profiles in the relevant tenant resources notebooks.

Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who manages domain configurations, I need the ability to remove unused lifecycle configurations and attach the correct default so that environments remain clean and consistent.

Acceptance Criteria

When unused lifecycle configurations are identified in sbx and dev core domains, they are deleted.
The correct lifecycle configuration is attached as the default in each domain.
Manual validation: Confirm only the correct default LCC is present in sbx and dev core domains.

Value Statement: As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who supports tenant workflows, I need the ability to research AWS Prompt Management and document requirements, use cases, and recommendations so that tenants can appropriately implement prompt management to save, access, and manage prompts.

Acceptance Criteria When research is completed, it includes detailed information on AWS Prompt Management, including requirements, use cases, and best practices. Documentation is created in Confluence following the technical documentation template. Recommendations are tailored to tenant needs. Provide references to relevant AWS documentation for further tenant exploration.
Add custom JupyterLab image with required dependencies for dev core domain to simplify environment configuration

Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who manages environments, I need the ability to build and use a custom JupyterLab image with all necessary dependencies so that tenant resources notebooks and mlkit runs reliably in the dev core domain.

Acceptance Criteria

Working off of the "custom-studio-image" branch in bip-ai-kit repo, the Dockerfile is updated to include all dependencies for tenant resources, mlkit, and other previously installed packages.
The custom image is built and attached in the dev core domain in the dev environment.
Manual validation: Confirm tenant resources notebooks execute successfully using the custom image.

As an engineer I want to create an api route that can take in dates and return a csv of all chats and responses

Acceptance Criteria
- Api route that will return a string for a csv file
- Add SQLite to a PVC or move to RDS

As an engineer I want to setup a SageMaker pipeline to refresh data from githubs and then update a knowledge base

Acceptance Criteria
-SageMaker pipeline script created to refresh a knowledge base

Value Statement: As an engineer I want to ingest notebooks from tenant-resources so ARIA can answer coding questions and return code snippets

Acceptance Criteria
- Notebooks ingested properly into a knowledge base 
- Prompts updated so code snippers can be returned

As an MLE I want to evaluate ARIA response with currents prompts and data to make sure common tenants questions are answered

Acceptance Criteria
- List of at least 10 common tenant questions made
- Test ARIA response to these questions and recommendations on how to enhance made in a confluence document

As an MLE developing MCPs, I want an initial template Helm chart created to easily deploy new MCPs consistently while building a foundation for best practices.

 

AC: 
 - Template Helm charts created that define secrets, & ingress in different deployment environments 
 - A template Helm chart exists with the following components:
 ** {{Chart.yaml}} and {{values.yaml}} scaffolding
 ** Environment-specific values files ({{{}values-sbx.yaml{}}})
 ** Core templates for Deployment, Service, Ingress, and ExternalSecret

-Notebook created that interacts with deployed MCP

items.from_string: Title Extract Bedrock invocation metrics and display in Grafana for Gen Ann Value Statement As Gen Ann, who uses AWS Bedrock services, I need the ability to view Bedrock invocation metrics in Grafana so that I can monitor and understand my usage. Update existing Bedrock invocation panel from being single value to aggregated values 

Value Statement
As Gen Ann, who uses AWS Bedrock services, I need the ability to view Bedrock invocation metrics in an aggregated manner. 


Acceptance Criteria

When Gen Ann accesses the Grafana dashboard, Bedrock invocation metrics are aggregated.
Aggregation should be sum total group by week for the last 4 weeks.

items.from_string:
Value Statement: As a BIP-AI Infrastructure engineer, I need to create comprehensive CompositeResourceDefinitions (XRDs) that define the schema and API contract for Bedrock Knowledge Base resources, including all necessary fields such as knowledge base name, description, role ARN, data source configurations, vector database settings, and embedding model specifications. 

Acceptance Criteria:

XRD Development: The XRDs must include proper validation rules, required fields, and default values to ensure consistent and secure knowledge base provisioning across different environments.

Composition Implementation: I need to develop Crossplane compositions that orchestrate the creation of AWS Bedrock Knowledge Bases along with their dependencies, including S3 buckets for data sources, IAM roles with appropriate permissions for Bedrock service access, vector databases (such as Amazon OpenSearch Serverless or Pinecone), and proper networking configurations. The compositions must handle resource ordering, dependency management, and include error handling for failed provisioning scenarios while supporting multiple deployment environments (dev, staging, production).

Claims and Testing: I need to create working claim examples that demonstrate end-to-end knowledge base provisioning, including sample data ingestion workflows and validation that the knowledge bases are functional and queryable. The implementation must include comprehensive testing through multiple claim scenarios, verification that knowledge bases appear correctly in the AWS Bedrock console, confirmation that vector embeddings are generated and stored properly, and validation that the knowledge bases can successfully respond to queries with relevant information retrieval.

Documentation and Integration: The story is complete when all components are fully documented with clear examples, troubleshooting guides, and integration patterns that align with existing Crossplane infrastructure, enabling other teams to easily provision and manage Bedrock knowledge bases through declarative YAML configurations without requiring deep AWS Bedrock expertise.
items.to_string:
Value Statment: As a BIP-AI Infrastructure engineer, I need to successfully create AWS Bedrock Agents through Crossplane compositions so that our AI infrastructure can provision intelligent agents automatically. 

Acceptance Criteria: The current compositions deploy without errors but fail to create the actual Bedrock agents, requiring investigation into the providerConfig configuration, IAM permissions, and resource dependencies. This story is complete when a Crossplane composition can successfully provision a functional Bedrock agent in AWS, including proper authentication setup through providerConfig, validation that the agent appears in the AWS Bedrock console, and verification that the agent can respond to basic queries, with all troubleshooting steps documented for future reference.

items.from_string:
Value Statement As a BIP-AI Infrastructure Engineer, I need to enable custom EFS volume attachment to SageMaker domains through crossplane claims, so that users can provision additional storage for their domains via Infrastructure as Code without manual intervention. Description With SageMaker 2.0 now available in our environment, users require the ability to attach custom EFS volumes to their SageMaker domains for enhanced storage capabilities. This story involves updating our existing crossplane compositions to support EFS volume attachment through the claim abstraction layers.

Acceptance Criteria When I update the sagemaker-domain-composition, then it needs to: Include configuration options for attaching custom EFS volumes Support EFS volume ID specification through composition parameters Maintain backward compatibility with existing domain deployments Handle EFS volume lifecycle management properly When I abstract EFS functionality to the composite resource level, then it needs to: Expose EFS volume parameters in the sagemaker-domain composite resource Provide clear configuration interface for EFS attachment Validate EFS volume ID format and accessibility Support optional EFS volume attachment (not required by default) When I integrate with the aitenantintake claim, then it needs to: Allow EFS volume specification through the parent claim Pass EFS configuration down through the composition hierarchy Maintain claim simplicity while providing EFS flexibility Support multiple EFS volumes if needed When I test EFS volume attachment in sandbox, then it needs to: Successfully attach specified EFS volume to SageMaker domain Verify EFS volume is accessible within the domain environment Support EFS volume removal without deployment errors Handle invalid EFS volume IDs gracefully with clear error messages When users specify EFS volume ID in claim values, then the system needs to: Automatically configure and attach the EFS volume to the domain Provide status feedback on attachment success or failure Support updating EFS volume configuration after initial deployment Enable clean removal when EFS volume ID is removed from claim Definition of Done SageMaker domain composition updated with EFS volume support Composite resource and claim abstractions include EFS parameters Successful testing completed in sandbox environment EFS volume attachment and removal validated Documentation updated with configuration examples
items.to_string:
Value Statement: As a BIP-AI Infrastructure engineer, I need to create comprehensive CompositeResourceDefinitions (XRDs) that define the schema and API contract for Bedrock Knowledge Base resources, including all necessary fields such as knowledge base name, description, role ARN, data source configurations, vector database settings, and embedding model specifications. 

Acceptance Criteria:

XRD Development: The XRDs must include proper validation rules, required fields, and default values to ensure consistent and secure knowledge base provisioning across different environments.

Composition Implementation: I need to develop Crossplane compositions that orchestrate the creation of AWS Bedrock Knowledge Bases along with their dependencies, including S3 buckets for data sources, IAM roles with appropriate permissions for Bedrock service access, vector databases (such as Amazon OpenSearch Serverless or Pinecone), and proper networking configurations. The compositions must handle resource ordering, dependency management, and include error handling for failed provisioning scenarios while supporting multiple deployment environments (dev, staging, production).

Claims and Testing: I need to create working claim examples that demonstrate end-to-end knowledge base provisioning, including sample data ingestion workflows and validation that the knowledge bases are functional and queryable. The implementation must include comprehensive testing through multiple claim scenarios, verification that knowledge bases appear correctly in the AWS Bedrock console, confirmation that vector embeddings are generated and stored properly, and validation that the knowledge bases can successfully respond to queries with relevant information retrieval.

Documentation and Integration: The story is complete when all components are fully documented with clear examples, troubleshooting guides, and integration patterns that align with existing Crossplane infrastructure, enabling other teams to easily provision and manage Bedrock knowledge bases through declarative YAML configurations without requiring deep AWS Bedrock expertise.
This issue is cloned by BIP-26823

items.to_string:
Value Statement:

As an infrastructure engineer, I need to implement an access control system in the BIP AI Gateway to enable conditional feature visibility for users based on their RBAC group memberships.

A/C
- The BIP Gateway must conditionally grant users access to UI routes, micro frontends, alerts, and microservices according to access control rules defined by their RBAC groups.
- Access permissions are enforced consistently across all relevant components.
- The system supports dynamic updates to RBAC group memberships and access rules.
- Proper logging and auditing are in place for access control decisions.
- Comprehensive documentation is provided for configuring and managing access control.

items.from_string:
As a member of the BIP-AI team developing infrastructure automation, I need to test the Crossplane Grafana provider in an ephemeral cluster so that we can validate its functionality and resource consumption before promoting it to higher environments.

Value Statement This enables us to validate the Grafana provider's functionality and accurately measure its resource requirements in isolation, ensuring we can deploy it safely to production environments with appropriate resource allocation and confident operational behavior.

Background We are implementing Grafana dashboard and panel automation through Crossplane providers. Before deploying this capability to production environments, we need to test the provider in an ephemeral cluster to validate functionality and measure actual resource consumption patterns for proper sizing and resource requests in production deployments.

Acceptance Criteria

Provider Image Availability

Grafana provider image is built and available in DEV ECR
Image is properly tagged and accessible for deployment
Provider image includes all necessary dependencies
Infrastructure as Code Deployment

Create feature branch in bip-tooling-crossplane-providers repository
Deploy Grafana provider to ephemeral cluster using IaC patterns
Provider deploys successfully with appropriate configuration
Provider Functionality Validation

Grafana provider is available and operational in ephemeral cluster
Deploy test Grafana resource (dashboard or panel) to validate functionality
Verify provider can successfully manage Grafana resources end-to-end
Resource Consumption Analysis

Monitor and document provider resource usage patterns
Capture CPU, memory, and network consumption metrics
Generate recommendations for production resource requests and limits
Documentation and Communication

Draft pull request with implementation details and findings
Advertise results to platform-engineering team
Include screenshots of provider pod metrics showing resource utilization during resource deployment
Definition of Done

Grafana provider successfully deployed to ephemeral cluster via IaC
Test Grafana resources deployed and managed successfully by provider
Resource consumption metrics collected and documented
Resource request recommendations prepared for production deployment
Provider functionality validated end-to-end
Pull request drafted and shared with platform-engineering team including screenshots of provider pod metrics during resource deployment operations
Technical Notes

Use existing Crossplane provider deployment patterns from bip-tooling-crossplane-providers
Follow standard ephemeral cluster testing procedures
Implement appropriate monitoring and metrics collection for resource analysis
Document any provider-specific configuration requirements or constraints
Ensure provider cleanup processes work correctly for ephemeral environments
Consider testing both creation and deletion workflows for complete validation
Capture metrics during both idle and active resource management operations

items.from_string:
Title
Update SageMaker lifecycle configuration script to use user profile security group.

Value Statement
As a BIP AI Tenant who sets up SageMaker environments, I need the ability to use my user profile security group by default in the lifecycle configuration script so that I can simplify environment setup and reduce manual configuration steps.

Acceptance Criteria
When a SageMaker domain is created or updated, the lifecycle configuration script automatically uses the user's profile security group by default.
The script provides clear error messages if the user profile security group is unavailable or misconfigured.
Validation
Test the lifecycle configuration script with various user profiles to confirm it correctly applies the user profile security group.
Verify that error handling and messaging are clear and actionable for tenants.
items.to_string:
Title: Troubleshoot issue of Sagemaker LCC not working when user profile security groups are used

Value Statement:
As a BIP AI Tenant who sets up SageMaker environments, I need the ability to use my user profile security group by default in the lifecycle configuration script so that I can simplify environment setup and reduce manual configuration steps.

Acceptance Criteria:
When a SageMaker domain is created or updated, the lifecycle configuration script automatically uses the user's profile security group by default, and does not time out
The script provides clear error messages if the user profile security group is unavailable or misconfigured.

Validation:
Test the lifecycle configuration script with various user profiles to confirm it correctly applies the user profile security group.
Verify that error handling and messaging are clear and actionable for tenants.
This issue is cloned by BIP-27044

Clean up SPA repo and re-enable Black and Pylint GitHub Actions checks

Value Statement

Acceptance Criteria

The SPA repo is cleaned up to ensure these checks pass.

Build SPA model training Jenkins pipeline to automate SageMaker training jobs

Value Statement

Acceptance Criteria

The pipeline logs training status and results.

Value Statement
As a BIP AI cloud security engineer who manages mlflow authentication access, I need the ability to update the group naming pattern to use EntraID group names so that tenant users can continue to access mlflow post EntraID migration.

Acceptance Criteria

1. The mlflow ingress allowed groups are updated to use EntraID group names ("OIT .....")
items.to_string:
Value Statement
As a BIP AI cloud security engineer who manages mlflow authentication access, I need the ability to bypass EntraID group names due to its whitespace constraint until there's a platform solution to integrate mlflow with EntraID, so that tenant users can continue to access mlflow post EntraID migration.

Acceptance Criteria
 # The mlflow ingress allowed groups are updated to bypass EntraID group names (e.g "OIT bip-dev-ai-admins")
 # Create separate ingresses for ui and api to prepare for platform's mlflow solution with EntraID.

items.from_string: Update mlflow ingress to use EntraID group names
items.to_string: Update mlflow ingress to bypass EntraID group names

Title: Develop interactive front-end table for Crossplane resources with filtering and action capabilities to enhance admin controls

Description: Create a Vue.js front-end component that displays all Crossplane resources (claims, composites, and managed resources) in an interactive table format. The component will consume data from the existing FastAPI endpoint that returns resource information as a dictionary with multiple parameters. The table will provide filtering capabilities, resource selection for actions, status display based on annotations, and direct links to resource manifests.

Value Statement: By providing an interactive front-end interface for all Crossplane resources, administrators gain a centralized view with filtering and action capabilities, improving operational efficiency and reducing the time needed to manage and monitor infrastructure resources.

Acceptance Criteria: • Vue.js component displays all Crossplane resources (claims, composites, managed resources) in a table format • Interactive search bar allows filtering of resources by name, type, or other relevant attributes • Table includes columns for resource name, type, namespace, status, and manifest link • Resource status is displayed based on the crossplane.io/paused annotation from API response • Checkboxes or selection mechanism allows users to select individual or multiple resources • Action buttons enable pause/resume operations on selected resources • Manifest column contains clickable links to view resource YAML definitions • Table design and styling matches existing "list paused resources" component format • Component integrates seamlessly with existing Vue.js application structure • Responsive design ensures table works across different screen sizes • Loading states and error handling are implemented for API interactions • Local development and testing completed using minikube cluster • Component follows existing UI patterns and design system

Definition of Done: • Vue.js component is fully implemented and functional • All filtering and selection features work correctly • Pause/resume actions integrate with existing API endpoints • Manifest links properly display resource definitions • Component styling matches existing application design • Local testing completed against minikube cluster with real data • Code follows Vue.js best practices and team coding standards • Component is ready for deployment to SBX environment • Documentation includes component usage and integration instructions
This issue is cloned by BIP-27031

Title
Build Jenkins pipeline to automate model retraining for SRI using SageMaker

Value Statement
As SRI, who manages deployed ML models, I need the ability to trigger and automate model retraining via a Jenkins pipeline that executes a SageMaker training job so that retraining is efficient, consistent, and requires minimal manual effort.

Acceptance Criteria

When a retraining request is initiated, the Jenkins pipeline triggers a SageMaker training job for the SRI model.
The pipeline logs retraining status and results.
The pipeline allows configuration of model-specific parameters.

Title
Build Jenkins pipeline to automate data ingestion for SRI

Value Statement
As SRI, who manages data for ML models, I need the ability to trigger and automate data ingestion using a Jenkins pipeline so that data is ingested efficiently and consistently with minimal manual effort.

Acceptance Criteria

When a data ingestion request is initiated, the Jenkins pipeline runs the SRI data ingestion process.
The pipeline logs ingestion status and results.
The pipeline allows configuration of data source parameters.

Title
Extract Bedrock invocation metrics and display in Grafana for Gen Ann

Value Statement
As Gen Ann, who uses AWS Bedrock services, I need the ability to view Bedrock invocation metrics in Grafana so that I can monitor and understand my usage.

Acceptance Criteria

When Gen Ann accesses the Grafana dashboard, Bedrock invocation metrics specific to Gen Ann are displayed.
Metrics include invocation counts and relevant usage details.
Dashboard updates automatically with new data.

Title
Add SPA validation Jenkins pipeline to run Bruno-based integration tests after endpoint deployment

Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who manages deployment pipelines, I need the ability to run SPA validation using Bruno-based integration tests automatically after deploying an endpoint so that endpoint functionality is verified before release.

Acceptance Criteria

When an endpoint is deployed, the Jenkins pipeline triggers SPA validation using Bruno-based integration tests.
The pipeline reports test results and failures.
The process is integrated into the existing deployment pipeline.
Documentation is updated to describe the validation step.
